üé§üé§üé§...featuring B-Realüé§üé§üé§

B-Real (–Ω–∞—Å—Ç. –∏–º—è ‚Äî –õ—É–∏—Å –§—Ä–∏—Å, –∞–Ω–≥–ª. Louis Freese) ‚Äî –∞–º–µ—Ä–∏–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π —Ä—ç–ø–µ—Ä, –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–µ–Ω –ø–æ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—é –≤ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–µ Cypress Hill.

–†–æ–¥–∏–ª—Å—è 2 –∏—é–Ω—è 1970 –≥–æ–¥–∞ –≤ —Å–µ–º—å–µ –º–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–∞–Ω—Ü–∞ –∏ –∫—É–±–∏–Ω–∫–∏. 
 
–í 80-–µ –≥–æ–¥—ã –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª—Å—è –±—Ä–µ–π–∫–¥–∞–Ω—Å–æ–º. –í 13-–ª–µ—Ç–Ω–µ–º –≤–æ–∑—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ –≤–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª –º–∞—Ä–∏—Ö—É–∞–Ω—É, –∞ –≤ 16 —Å—Ç–∞–ª –æ—Ç—Ü–æ–º. 
 
–°–æ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º –ø–æ –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤—É Sen Dog‚Äô–æ–º (–®–µ–Ω–æ–Ω –†–µ–π–µ—Å), –æ–Ω –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏–ª—Å—è –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª–µ. –õ—É–∏—Å –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Ä—ç–ø–µ—Ä–æ–º. –ò–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –æ–Ω —É–≤–ª–µ–∫–∞–ª—Å—è –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–æ–π (–¥–æ –∏—Å–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏–∑ —à–∫–æ–ª—ã Bell High), –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–ª –ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏, –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª —Å–µ–±—è –≤ –ø–æ—ç–∑–∏–∏. –ù–æ —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–µ –¥–æ–ª–≥–æ, –õ—É–∏—Å –±—Ä–æ—Å–∏–ª —à–∫–æ–ª—É –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–æ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º –æ—Ç—Ü–æ–º. –° –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä—å—é –∏ —Å–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–µ—Ö–∞–ª –≤ Bell Area. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —á–µ–≥–æ –õ—É–∏—Å –≤—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏–ª –≤ –ø—Ä–µ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—É—é –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫—É South Central Bloods, –≥–¥–µ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä—É —Ç–æ—Ä–≥–æ–≤—Ü–∞ –Ω–∞—Ä–∫–æ—Ç–∏–∫–∞–º–∏. 
 
–ü–æ–∑–∂–µ B-Real –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—Å—è —Å DJ Muggs (–õ–æ—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Å –ú–∞–≥–≥–µ—Ä–∞–¥ (Lawrence Muggerud). –í 1988 –≥–æ–¥—É –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª –≤ –±–æ–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ü—É —Å –ø—É–ª–µ–≤—ã–º —Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –≤ –≥—Ä—É–¥—å, –∑–∞–¥–µ—Ç–æ –ª—ë–≥–∫–æ–µ. 
 
–≠—Ç—É —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏—é –æ–Ω –æ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –ø–µ—Å–Ω–µ ¬´Lick A Shot¬ª. –°–≤–æ–∏–º —Å–ø–∞—Å–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –æ–Ω –æ–±—è–∑–∞–Ω Sen Dog‚Äô—É –∏ DJ Muggs‚Äô—É. 
 
B-Real, Sen Dog, DJ Muggs –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏–ª–∏—Å—å —Å –≠—Ä–∏–∫–æ–º –ö–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∞ (Eric‚Äô–æ–º ¬´Bobo¬ª Correa) –≤ 90-–µ –≥–æ–¥—ã. –ß–ª–µ–Ω–æ–º –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã –æ–Ω —Å—Ç–∞–ª –≤ 94-–º. –í 1996 –≥–æ–¥—É –±—ã–ª —á–ª–µ–Ω–æ–º –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã The Psycho Realm, –Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–∂–µ –ø–æ–∫–∏–Ω—É–ª –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—É –∏–∑-–∑–∞ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ä–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ Cypress Hill. 
 
–û—Å–µ–Ω—å—é 2016 –≥–æ–¥–∞ –æ–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏–ª—Å—è —Å –±—ã–≤—à–∏–º–∏ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ Rage Against the Machine –¢–æ–º–æ–º –ú–æ—Ä–µ–ª–ª–æ, –¢–∏–º–æ–º –ö–æ–º–º–µ—Ä—Ñ–æ—Ä–¥–æ–º –∏ –ë—Ä—ç–¥–æ–º –£–∏–ª–∫–æ–º, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Å –ß–∞–∫–æ–º –î–∏ –∏–∑ Public Enemy –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–≤ —Å—É–ø–µ—Ä–≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—É Prophets of Rage.

–î–∏—Å

PhD and postdoc positions in software engineering and verification at ITMO, Saint Petersburg 

The newly created Chair of Software Engineering and Verification (–ö–∞—Ñ–µ–¥—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–π –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∏–∏ –∏ –≤–µ—Ä–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏) at ITMO, under Professor Bertrand Meyer, has positions open for PhD students (–∞—Å–ø–∏—Ä–∞–Ω—Ç—ã) and postdocs (–∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç—ã). Salaries are attractive and comparable to those in industry. Successful candidates must have completed or be close to completing a master's degree (–º–∞–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞) for the PhD student positions, and a PhD ¬†in the case of postdoc positions. They must have a solid theoretical background in computer science, an excellent practice of software analysis, design and implementation, and a passion for research at the highest level. They should have at least some of the following: 

 ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†- Published papers in scientific conferences. 
 ¬†¬†- Experience with software verification techniques, particularly proofs (e.g. Hoare-style semantics, model checking, abstract interpretation, SMT solving). 
 ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†- Experience of large-scale software development. 
 ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†- In-depth knowledge of object-oriented techniques, especially as used in Eiffel. 
 ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†- Theoretical knowledge and practice of concurrent programming. 

Good command of English, written and spoken, is necessary. 
ITMO is particularly known for its excellence in teaching as attested by numerous successes in programming competition, including winning the ACM world programming championship three times. The Cha

Successful candidates must have completed or be close to completing a master's degree for the PhD student positions, and a PhD in the case of postdoc positions. They must have a solid theoretical background in computer science, an excellent practice of software analysis, design and implementation, and a passion for research at the highest level. Interested candidates should send an email expressing their interest."}

input:
Investment in new projects is helping to drive growth within the amusement industry in the Middle East and parts of Africa, said Warehouse of Games‚Äô Yuhanis Nawasreh.

The Dubai-based company‚Äôs sales and development manager explained that the last two years has seen the market ‚Äúpick up‚Äù in the region. 

‚ÄúI believe now that the Middle East is the only region that is picking up again,‚Äù Nawasreh told InterGame at this week‚Äôs DEAL show. ‚ÄúThere are a lot projects coming up in Saudi, Doha in Qatar, Jordan and even in Africa, in places like Sudan.‚Äù

Not all the Middle East is experiencing this level of growth he said, but the UAE, Saudi, Jordan and Qatar are all presently stable and seeing a significant level of investment.

Interestingly, the new projects in Sudan are being modeled on those found in Dubai, for example, with operators selecting the best games and prizes, he said.

A full report from the 2013 DEAL show in Dubai will appear in the forthcoming June issue of InterGame.

Pictured is the Warehouse of Games Stand with the famous SnoCross by Winter-X Games during the DEAL 2013 Show in Dubai.

Source: InterGame Magazine
output: {"tags": ["amusement industry", "Middle East", "Africa", "investment", "new projects"], "title": "Investment in new projects driving growth in Middle East and Africa amusement industry", "summarization": "According to Warehouse of Games‚Äô sales and development manager, Yuhanis Nawasreh, investment in new projects is driving growth in the amusement industry in the Middle East and parts of Africa. The market has picked up in the last two years, with the Middle East being the only region experiencing growth. Countries such as Saudi, Doha in Qatar, Jordan, and even Sudan are seeing significant levels of investment. The new projects in Sudan are being modeled on those found in Dubai. The full report will appear in the forthcoming June issue of InterGame."}

input:
Bill Gate's Rules for Students
#read_original@terytoriya14 

Rule No. 1: Life is not fair. Get used to it. The average teen-ager uses the phrase ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not fair‚Äù 8.6 times a day. You got it from your parents, who said it so often you decided they must be the most idealistic generation ever. When they started hearing it from their own kids, they realized Rule No. 1. 

Rule No. 2: The real world won‚Äôt care as much about your self-esteem as much as your school does. It‚Äôll expect you to accomplish something before you feel good about yourself. This may come as a shock. Usually, when inflated self-esteem meets reality, kids complain that it‚Äôs not fair. (See Rule No. 1) 
 
Rule No. 3: Sorry, you won‚Äôt make $40,000 a year right out of high school. And you won‚Äôt be a vice president or have a car phone either. You may even have to wear a uniform that doesn‚Äôt have a Gap label. 
 
Rule No. 4: If you think your teacher is tough, wait ‚Äôtil you get a boss. He doesn‚Äôt have tenure, so he tends to be a bit edgier. When you screw up, he‚Äôs not going to ask you how you feel about it. 
 
Rule No. 5: Flipping burgers is not beneath your dignity. Your grandparents had a different word for burger flipping. They called it opportunity. They weren‚Äôt embarrassed making minimum wage either. They would have been embarrassed to sit around talking about Kurt Cobain all weekend. 
 
Rule No. 6: It‚Äôs not your parents‚Äô fault. If you screw up, you are responsible. This is the flip side of ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs my life,‚Äù and ‚ÄúYo
output: {"tags": ["life lessons", "education", "career advice"], "title": "Bill Gate's Rules for Students", "summarization": "Bill Gates shares seven rules for students to prepare them for the real world. He emphasizes the importance of accepting that life is not fair, and that self-esteem must be earned through accomplishments. Gates also reminds students that success takes time and hard work, and that mistakes will have consequences. He encourages students to embrace opportunities, even if they seem menial, and to take responsibility for their actions. Finally, Gates reminds students to appreciate their parents and the sacrifices they have made for them."}

Husky Hoskulds whose 8 Bit Audio production company has produced recordings for Tom Waits, Fant√¥mas, Joe Henry, The Wallflowers and many more.The philosophy behind 8 Bit Kit is to deliver fascinating and different sounds: kicks detuned and hit with paint rollers or with chains attached; modified snares with calf-skin or kevlar heads fitted; unique cracked and warped hihats. input:
This is the oldest book I could find! It was written nearly 2,5 thousand!!! years ago, but most of the ideas are acute even now! I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs worth getting acquainted with the key thoughts!

So, 30-seconds overview \/ 3 key thoughts of the book:

1. Justice is minding one‚Äôs own business - responsibly play our appropriate role (acknowledge it and then ably fulfil it) and thereby benefit both ourselves and our society
2. Society and souls are divided into 3 parts: city rulers (rational part of the soul), guardians (spirited part of the soul), farmers and craft workers (desirous part of the soul). Every person has all the three parts, but some prevail
3. Life of cities cycles from aristocracy (best people) - to timocracy (honour people) - oligarchy (money people) - democracy (mixed people) to tyranny (ego of one man) and back (spurred by the ruled revolting against the rulers).

3-minutes overview:

1. What is justice
    1. Polemarchus (to give each person what they are owed \/ assisting friends and fighting enemies) - Socrates thinks that insane people or who threaten to do harm to others should not be given what they are owed; finds there are not any circumstances under which it is moral to do harm; and we can mistake friends for enemies
    2. Thrasymachus (whatever is advanteous to the ruler) - Socrates thinks the ruler should aim to do good for his city (I personally think that there is an option where those aims are synchronized (perhaps in a totally transparent city))
output: {"tags": ["philosophy", "justice", "society"], "title": "Key Thoughts from the Oldest Book Found", "summarization": "The oldest book found, written nearly 2,5 thousand years ago, contains ideas that are still relevant today. The book discusses justice and how it is important to mind one's own business and play our appropriate role to benefit ourselves and society. Society and souls are divided into three parts, and every person has all three parts, but some prevail. The book also talks about the life cycle of cities and how they cycle from aristocracy to tyranny and back. The appropriate roles of individuals are shaped by the need of the city and individual's skills. In a just city, the city's need and individual's needs work symbiotically."}
